text: hi everyone thick thingy frame tano here
the internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time for a review of the new alton
goon project y'all yes this is the third
full-length album from
alton goon a netherlands band that
specializes
in turkish fusions of rock
psych and also folk i was introduced to
the band
through the hype around their last
couple of releases and i certainly got
the appeal even if i didn't find these
records particularly exciting myself
but alton goon seems to be adding synth
pop to their repertoire on this new
project
which i guess could result in something
snappier more versatile
i mean the 30 second opener on this
thing gives you an idea of how much
added dramatic atmosphere the band is
working with
this time around the track then
stealthily slides into these neon
colored synth leads and beats on the
following area
now while the vocals on this cut do have
an exotic flavor to them
it is a little unfortunate that the band
transitions
into this incredibly generic 80s sound
pretty much losing all the jammie plucky
characteristics that made alton goon
so appealing in the first place i mean
it sounds like something from the
stranger things soundtrack
thankfully this is the only track on the
record that seems to be
on some 80s analog synth porn but
there are some other
spacey groovy synthetic risks taken on
this record that do pan out
the third track on this lp is a quirky
piece of synth pop with bubbly fun
arpeggios and guitars that blare and
fire off like they're soundtracking the
theme to some kind of spy movie
all of this underscores some very
passionate and angular lead vocals
and overall the performance here is
impeccably tight
the fifth track on this thing is loaded
with reverb synth chords w effects
hits of melodica in between the bits of
hand drums and hand claps
easily one of the more colorful and
spacey jams here they're all
is like the band's own brand of
flamboyant disco-infused funk
laced with bold turkish melodies and
sharp wah guitar licks
and of course i have to mention how
irresistibly cute the closer is
it's one of those rare moments where an
artist wants to
come out with a low key end to their
record but
knowing that that is the case for a lot
of albums out there
they almost take it to the extreme to
make sure their version of doing that
stands out
that manifests in some of the sweetest
and most
intimate vocals on the entire record we
have these beats and synth tones that
sound like they're coming out of a
very cheap casio i'm loving the subtle
return of the w delays on this track too
and all around the
tune of the track is very pretty now
despite all the changes alton goon
brings to the table on this record there
are still plenty of moments where the
band returns very handily
to that 70s flavored jammy anatolian
rock
that they're known for but now with a
few added bells and whistles to expand
their already very solid flavor profile
their seb de ulma side where the
shimmering synths add quite a bit to the
already rockin drums and guitar
hey nari also features some of the most
impressive drum and guitar work on the
entire record
if i have to nitpick something on this
lp and
i do it's that there's a little lull
around the halfway point of this thing
the sixth track here is a skeletal piece
of synth pop that's
maybe a bit too stripped back for its
own good then the following arduboy lara
is a washed out vocal and synth piece
that
is an okay motif i guess i mean really
it's the most
uh filler track on the entire record
still though with all of that being said
i still think this is a very solid lp
and while alton goon does not stand as
one of my favorite bands of the moment
right now there are lots of great cuts
on this record and if you're ignoring
this band you are missing out
cause i can't really think of anyone
else bringing together these sounds of
psych and rock and folk and synth with a
specifically
turkish flavor and doing it at this
level of visibility
feeling a decent two strong seven on
this one tran
